MPC

Class InputPos

  • java.lang.Object
    • MPC.InputPos

  • public abstract class InputPos
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for packing an source input position (line, column) into a single Java int. At present it merely uses 16 bits each for line and column, and does no overflow checking. This is adequate for MPC but falls short of the robustness one desires in a production quality compiler. By convention (an unlike Java array indexing) the first line and first column are numbered 1.
    Version:
    1.0

      stores file positions of new line characters for computing line/col from file position

      static int lineOf(int filePos)
      returns the line number of a file position line numbers start with 1, and we view the newlines as being on the next line at column 0
      static void noteNL(int filePos)
      Notes, in NLpos, where an NL character appears in the input; assumes NLs are noted in increasing order of file position :-)

    • Method Detail

      • noteNL

        public static void noteNL(int filePos)
        Notes, in NLpos, where an NL character appears in the input; assumes NLs are noted in increasing order of file position :-)
        Parameters:
        filePos - position in the input file where an NL character appears; the first position is 0, i.e., we use offsets from the beginning of the file

      • lineOf

        public static int lineOf(int filePos)
        returns the line number of a file position line numbers start with 1, and we view the newlines as being on the next line at column 0
        Parameters:
        filePos - the file position
        Returns:
        the line containing that position; first line is 1

      • columnOf

        public static int columnOf(int filePos)
        returns the column number for a file position
        Parameters:
        filePos - the file position
        Returns:
        the column number for that position; 0 means the newline that started the line
